members.description: Richard Delamore, known by his online pseudonym Evildea, is an Australian Esperanto YouTube-personality and leading figure in the Esperanto film industry. Prior to co-founding Amikumu, Richard founded Esperanto-TV and served on the Board of Directors for the Australian Esperanto Association (AEA), the Language Festival Association (LFA) and the Esperanto Federation of New South Wales (EFNSW). Additionally, he’s served six years in the Australian army as a signals operator and worked for numerous international businesses as a systems administrator.
members.name: Richard Delamore
members.quote: Amikumu is an essential part of every language learner’s toolkit.

members.description: Chuck Smith is the co-organizer of the Polyglot Gathering, contributor of Duolingo’s Esperanto course and founder of the Esperanto Wikipedia, among other Esperanto and polyglot projects. He has been developing iOS apps since Apple’s App Store launched in 2008. He had the idea for a GPS device to find fellow Esperanto speakers while traveling through Brazil in 2002, but needed to wait 15 years for technology to catch up, so he could pursue this dream. Now he looks forward to meeting the challenges ahead to help people everywhere connect to make the world a better place.
members.job_title: Chief Technical Officer and Mobile Developer
members.languages: Engleză, esperanto, germană, spaniolă, franceză, neerlanseză, poloneză, ASL
members.name: Chuck Smith
members.quote: I love seeing all the great ways people are meeting up to speak different languages with Amikumu all over the world!

members.description:
Tanja is a stay at home geek who has extensive experience in customer support (both front and back office) for several ISPs. In her free time she codes, creates various items with yarn and plays videogames (or does the New York Times crossword puzzle).

After re-entering the world of Esperanto, she voluntarily helped rewrite the code for the current version of Amikumu, as well as being responsible for the layout.
members.name: Tanja Orme
members.quote: Amikumu makes it so easy to meet new people who share my interests, no matter where I am. I love working on an app that I use myself and help users get the best experience out of it!

members.description: Judith Meyer is a computational linguist spending most of her time developing web applications that deal with languages, such as her project LearnYu. She is also a polyglot, co-organizer of the Polyglot Gathering and author of many language books and language courses. She learned Esperanto when she was 14 years old so as to use it as a springboard to learning many other languages.
members.languages: Germană, engleză, esperanto, latină, franceză, italiană, greacă modernă, mandarină chineză, olandeză, spaniolă, italiană, ebraică, swahili
members.name: Judith Meyer
members.quote: Amikumu is a boon for polyglots like me – I'm always surprised by who speaks Greek, Hebrew or Indonesian around me.

members.description: Jesse Alter is a Linux system administrator with degrees in Computer Science and Social Work. Over the years, Jesse has maintained servers for multiple websites and services while working as a pediatric social worker. He later changed his career to follow his lifelong interest in developing and maintaining computer systems. Apart from Amikumu, Jesse’s interests include retrocomputing, information privacy, and data analysis.
members.name: Jesse Alter
members.quote: Amikumu gives me the ability to instantly find language partners for any language I know or am interested in, wherever I am. To me, that’s a superpower.

After graduation, she learned Esperanto and has since worked for multiple organizations and events. Highlights include her voluntary service for E@I in Slovakia and the 101st World Esperanto Congress among other projects. Recently she completed a project of her own: cards for the game “Werewolves”.

members.quote: The beauty of Amikumu is that it doesn’t only help me find new language partners, but also make new friends offline.

post_content.#text: Firstly, a massive thanks for your interest in the Ambassador program.

section.#text: Essentially, an ambassador is someone who helps promote Amikumu within their local community. They're our representatives on the ground! Our biggest fans and greatest supporters.
section.title: Ce este un ambasador?

section.#text: It depends on what they can commit. We've listed some of the ways our ambassadors are working with us to promote Amikumu around the world.
section.title: Ce face un ambasador?
section.ul:
#. They're publishing blog posts and YouTube videos! For example, check out `Amikumu: The App Yiddish Speakers have been Waiting for! <https://youtu.be/6g3QtBtBB_U>`_ (Moshe Sherizen) and `Auslan: What is Amikumu? <https://youtu.be/57W73If51NE>`_ (Kiah Morante) among others. We have an entire page dedicated to `press releases <http://amikumu.com/press/>`_.
 	#. They're posting links in Facebook groups and on their profiles. Even a simple show of public support can go a long way!
 	#. They're handing out flyers and talking about Amikumu in local language meetups. This is also a great way to establish and grow a local community.
 	#. They're `translating the app <https://traduk.amikumu.com/engage/amikumu/ro>`_ and website to their local languages. Our goal is to become the most translated app in the world and we need all the help to achieve this.
 	#. They're providing vitally important guidance. We understand that every language and culture is different. We want and need your advise on how to best act in your community.

section.#text: There's little we can provide for your invaluable help. However, there are a few perks to being an ambassador. We provide ambassadors with unique in-app collectible badges among other things. Feel free to reach out to us for more info at `info@amikumu.com <mailto:info@amikumu.com>`_.
section.title: Ce primesc ambasadori?

subsection.#text:
Amikumu is an app that helps you find people nearby to speak any language with.
For example, while on holiday, use Amikumu to meet up with Spanish, French or any other language speakers in town.
subsection.title: Ce este Amikumu?

subsection.ol:
#. Create an account manually or with Facebook.
 	#. Select the languages you speak and at what level. There are over 7,000 languages (including 100+ sign languages) in our database.
 	#. Write a custom name and description for each language you speak.
 	#. Filter the Nearby list to find the 100 people closest nearby who speak your target language(s).
 	#. Contact others and meetup!
subsection.title: Cum funcţionează?

subsection.#text: Da.
subsection.title: Este gratuit?

subsection.#text: Amikumu este disponibil pentru Android (OS 4.0.3), iOS 9.1 (iPhone 4S, iPad 2 +).
subsection.title: La ce dispozitive funcționează Amikunu?

subsection.#text: Your privacy and safety is very important to us, so Amikumu does not store or show exact locations.
subsection.title: Poate alți oameni să vadă unde eu sunt?

subsection.#text: You can’t, but Amikumu has a user blocking feature. When you block a user, they can no longer see nor contact you.
subsection.title: How can I ensure that strange people don’t contact me?

subsection.#text: We at Amikumu are friendly to open source. Unfortunately, open source does not currently fit our organization. We are, however, looking into opportunities to open source when we feel that it is the right fit for us.
subsection.title: Este Amikumu open source?

subsection.#text: Da, vă poate ajuta la traducerea Amikumu a `limba ta aici <https://traduk.amikumu.com/engage/amikumu/ro>`_.
subsection.title: Pot să traduc Amikumu?

subsection.#text: Amikumu înseamnă " stau cu prieteni" în Esperanto.
subsection.title: Ce înseamnă Amikumu?

subsection.#text: We welcome your feedback so join `our mailing list <http://eepurl.com/c4qiRD>`_, or follow us on `Facebook <https://www.facebook.com/amikumuapp/>`_,`Twitter <https://twitter.com/Amikumu>`_şi `VK <https://vk.com/amikumu>`_ să fiu informat. Pentru mai multe întrebări, ne-a lovit la`info@amikumu.com <mailto:info@amikumu.com>`_>

#. Nume pentru reclamă
 	#. Imagine de înaltă calitate pentru reclamă

post_content.#text:
Mulțumim pentru interesul tău de a sprijini Amikumu. 

Iată opt pași simpli de urmat pentru a-ți arăta sprijinul și a ajuta comunitatea să crească.

subsection.#text: În fiecare lună publicăm un newsletter cu informații din culise în ceea ce privește planurile și succesele noastre. Primim de asemenea contribuții din partea membrilor comunității precum ești tu. Acesta este modul nostru de a vorbi direct cu tine. `Abonează-te aici. <http://eepurl.com/c4qiRD>`_.
subsection.title: 1. Abonează-te la newsletterul nostru

subsection.#text: Suntem prezenți pe cele mai populare rețele de socializare.
subsection.title: 2. Urmărește-ne pe rețelele de socializare

subsection.#text:
Distribuie aplicația noastră prietenilor tăi pe rețelele de socializare sau pe email!

Cu cât mai mulți oameni aud despre Amikumu, cu atât mai util devine pentru noi toți. Distribuie linkul către pagina noastră oficială `www.amikumu.com <https://www.amikumu.com>`_și spune de ce îți place atât de mult.
subsection.title: 3. Vorbește despre noi prietenilor tăi

subsection.#text:
Scopul nostru este de a deveni cea mai tradusă aplicație din lume! Acest lucru nu este ușor, de aceea avem nevoie de sprijinul tău!

Pentru a contribui la o traducere existentă sau a începe una nouă, te rugăm să te înscrii pe `Amikumu-Weblate <https://traduk.amikumu.com/engage/amikumu/ro>`_ (serviciul nostru preferat pentru traducere) și să alegi limba în care dorești să traduci. Nu există un minim necesar, poți traduce întreaga aplicație sau doar un cuvânt – tu decizi.
subsection.title: 4. Ajută la traducerea aplicației și a site-ului!

subsection.#text: Gold membership conține caracteristici adiționale precum teleportarea virtuală și setări adiționale de confidențialitate. În plus, este un mod excelent de a-ți arăta sprijinul și de a ne ajuta cu o finanțare valoroasă! Poți achiziționa pachetul Gold Membership în aplicație (în curând!).
subsection.title: 5. Achiziționează pachetul Gold Membership!

subsection.#text: Un tricou este un mod simplu și eficient de a face reclamă Amikumu. Vezi `magazinul online <https://www.amikumu.com/shop/#!/>`_.
subsection.title: 6. Cumpără un tricou sau o cană!

subsection.#text: `Am pregătit pliante pe care le poți distribui  <https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1dDB0mvFuLXYycQtA1ZSxgOCJR-2gHAXv?usp=sharing>`_ la școală, universitate și în clubul local de limbi. Acestea au fost de asemenea traduse în multe limbi pentru ca tu să le poți folosi. Dacă dorești pliante la comandă, te rugăm să ne contactezi la adresa `info@amikumu.com <mailto:info@amikumu.com>`_
subsection.title: 7. Printează și distribuie pliantele noastre

subsection.#text:
La final, întâlnește oameni cu Amikumu și împărtășește povestea ta! Ne place să împărtășim povești despre întâlniri de succes cu comunitatea noastră. Trimite-ne poveștile și fotografiile tale la adresa `info@amikumu.com. <mailto:info@amikumu.com>`_

Nu în ultimul rând, mulțumim enorm pentru orice mod în care ne poți ajuta.

Dacă ai idei sau sugestii, contactează-ne la adresa`info@amikumu.com <mailto:info@amikumu.com>`_.>
subsection.title: 8. Organizează întâlniri!
